Key Match Events: Deni Avdija scored 26 points, Shaedon Sharpe added 21 points, and the Portland Trail Blazers led wire to wire in a 119-100 victory over the New Orleans Pelicans.
Anfernee Simons scored 17 points and Toumani Camara 15 for Portland.
Deandre Ayton scored 11 points and grabbed 13 rebounds for the Blazers.
CJ McCollum scored 23 points and Dejounte Murray 20 for New Orleans.
Pelicans forward Herb Jones left the game in the third quarter because of a right shoulder injury.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Portland shot 67.4% (31 of 46) through the first 24 minutes, setting a season high for a first half with 75 points.
